citation.article-title: Novosphingobium hassiacum sp. nov., a new species isolated from an aerated sewage pond.

p.s: Description of Novosphingobium hassiacum sp. nov.
[has.sí.a.cum, M.L. adj. hassiacum, “of Hesse”, referring to the German state of Hesse, where the organism was first isolated].
Cells are straight rods, 0.8 to 1.2 μm by 1 to 2 μm.
Cells occur singly, they are motile, Gram-negative, oxidase positive, catalase positive; with an oxidative, chemoheterotrophic metabolism.
Cells may also occur in chains and in liquid media a tendency of agglomeration is observed.
Ubiquinone Q-10 is the major quinone type, beside low amounts of ubiquinone Q-9; spermidine is the major polyamine.

The polar lipid profile is characterized by the presence of a sphingoglycolipid, in addition to phosphatidylethanolamine, diphosphatidylglycerol, and phosphatidylcholine and minor amounts of phosphatidylglycerol and phosphatidylmonomethylethanolamine.
The fatty acids 17:1 ω6c, 18:1 ω7c and summed feature 4 (16:1 ω7c and iso 15:0 2OH), in addition to the three hydroxylated fatty acids (13:0 2OH, 14:0 2OH, and 15:0 2OH) are produced.
On nutrient agar, colonies are circular, opaque slightly raised, and yellow with entire margins.
The type strain W-51T grew well at 15 to 30 °C on different complex media, like R2A-agar, PTYG agar, no growth was found at 4, 37 and 42 °C on R2A agar.
No growth occurred on MacConkey agar.
Nitrate reduction is positive.
N2 or H2S is not produced.
Indole production, growth on Simmons citrate, urease, arginine dihydrolase, hydrolysis of starch are all negative.
DNA is hydrolyzed.

No acid production from the following sugars could be detected: glucose, lactose, sucrose, D-mannitol, dulcitol, salicin, adonitol, inositol, sorbitol, L-arabinose, raffinose, L-rhamnose, maltose, D-xylose, trehalose, cellobiose, methyl-D-glucoside, erythritol, melibiose, D-arabitol and D-mannose.
Utilization of D-glucose (weak), D-cellobiose, sucrose, acetate, propionate, DL-3-hydroxybutyrate, suberate (weak), L-proline, and 4-hydroxybenzoate was positive.

The following compounds are not utilized as sole sources of carbon: N-acetylgalactosamine, N-acetylglucosamine, L-arabinose, L-arbutine, D-galactose, gluconate, D-maltose, D-mannose, α-D-melibiose, L-rhamnose, D-ribose, sucrose, salicine, D-trehalose, D-xylose, adonitol, i-inositol, D-sorbitol, glycerol, D-fructose, D-mannitol, maltitol, putrescine, cis-aconitate, trans-aconitate, 4-aminobutyrate, citrate, mesaconate, adipate, azelate, fumarate, glutarate, itaconate, DL-lactate, 2-oxoglutarate, pyruvate, L-aspartate, L-alanine, b-alanine, L-ornithine, Lphenylalanine, L-serine, L-histidine, L-leucine, L-tryptophan,
3-hydroxybenzoate, and phenylacetate.
The chromogenic substrates pNP-α-D-glucopyranoside, bis-pNP-phosphate, 2-deoxythymidine-5′-p-nitrophenyl-phosphate, L-alanine-p-nitroanilide, and L-glutamate-γ-3-carboxy-pNA were hydrolysed.

The following compounds are not hydrolyzed: p-nitrophenyl-β-D-galactopyranoside (pNPG), ONPG, p-nitrophenyl-β-D-glucuronide, p-nitrophenyl-β-D-glucopyranoside, p-nitrophenyl-β-D-xylopyranoside, L-proline-p-nitroanilide, and p-nitrophenyl-phosphoryl-choline.

Susceptible to amoxycillin/clavulanic acid, ampicillin, bacitracin, chloramphenicol, colistin sulphate, furazolidone, fusidic acid, gentamycin, kanamycin, nitrofurantoin, polymyxin B, and tetracycline.
Resistant to penicillin G and streptomycin.
The type strain is strain W-51T (=DSM 14552T = CIP 107176T).
Strain W-51T has been isolated from a sewage pond on 10-fold diluted PTYG agar.
The 16S rRNA gene sequence is deposited at the EMBL data bank under the accession number AJ416411.
